page.title: 04INDUSTRIAL CHANGE
page.content: For almost two centuries,coal mining was the mainstay of the area,but the 1960's saw the end of deep mining and only occasional opencast coal working has taken place since then.A number of factories were built between the two world wars,and many of these are at the end of their useful life,some now lying empty and one having been demol- ished in 1985.Some industrial building was done in the 1960's;these have been badly hit by recession and one,which employs some 300 workers,has recently announced that it will close at the end of 1985 unless there is a signif- icant increase in demand for its prod- ucts.A number of specialised manufact- ories built since 1970 in the east of the block are fairly successful,and a number of "small business units"have recently been built by the council.
